title: Indian Students Outnumber Chinese In US Universities, A First In 15 Years
content: India made up 29% of international students, but China was still a major source, constituting about one-fourth of international students.
summary: India made up 29% of international students, but China was still a major source, constituting about one-fourth of international students.

title: Russia Says Ukraine Fired 2 More American Missiles, Vows Retaliation
content: Moscow on Tuesday vowed to retaliate after announcing Ukraine had struck Russian military installations with US-supplied weapons, after President Vladimir Putin had warned Kyiv and the West against the missile attacks.
summary: Moscow on Tuesday vowed to retaliate after announcing Ukraine had struck Russian military installations with US-supplied weapons, after President Vladimir Putin had warned Kyiv and the West against the missile attacks.

title: Russia Bans Entry To Senior UK Government Ministers
content: Russia on Tuesday banned a string of Britain's cabinet ministers from entering the country in response to what it called London's "Russophobic" policies.
summary: Russia on Tuesday banned a string of Britain's cabinet ministers from entering the country in response to what it called London's "Russophobic" policies.

title: Russia Expels UK Diplomat Accused Of Espionage
content: Russia said on Tuesday it was expelling a British diplomat who it accused of espionage and summoned London's ambassador to the foreign ministry in Moscow.
summary: Russia said on Tuesday it was expelling a British diplomat who it accused of espionage and summoned London's ambassador to the foreign ministry in Moscow.

title: G7 To 'Comply With Respective Obligations' Over Netanyahu Arrest Warrant
content: G7 foreign ministers said Tuesday they "will comply with our respective obligations" regarding the arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC).
summary: G7 foreign ministers said Tuesday they "will comply with our respective obligations" regarding the arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC).

title: Israel Should Halve Gaza's Population, Says Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich
content: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich has said Israel should occupy the Gaza Strip and halve its Palestinian population by encouraging "voluntary emigration".
summary: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich has said Israel should occupy the Gaza Strip and halve its Palestinian population by encouraging "voluntary emigration".

title: Murderer Bursts Firecrackers Outside Victim's Home After Release From Jail
content: The event, which included a red carpet and festive displays, was held in the rural Sichuan province and drew widespread outrage from the public and the victim's family.
summary: The event, which included a red carpet and festive displays, was held in the rural Sichuan province and drew widespread outrage from the public and the victim's family.

title: Prince Harry's Privacy Lawsuit Against Daily Mail To Go To Trial In 2026
content: Prince Harry and other high-profile British figures' privacy lawsuits against the Daily Mail newspaper's publisher will go to trial in early 2026.
summary: Prince Harry and other high-profile British figures' privacy lawsuits against the Daily Mail newspaper's publisher will go to trial in early 2026.

title: Tariffs Will Not Stop US-Bound Migrants Or Drugs, Mexico Tells Trump
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said Tuesday that import tariffs proposed by President-elect Donald Trump will do nothing to stop US-bound undocumented migration or drug trafficking.
summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said Tuesday that import tariffs proposed by President-elect Donald Trump will do nothing to stop US-bound undocumented migration or drug trafficking.

title: Israel Army Says Hit 20 'Terror Targets' In Beirut
content: The Israeli army said it carried out a series of strikes on 20 "terror targets" belonging to the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah in the Beirut area on Tuesday.
summary: The Israeli army said it carried out a series of strikes on 20 "terror targets" belonging to the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah in the Beirut area on Tuesday.

title: 'Record' Drone Barrage Pummels Ukraine As Missile Tensions Seethe
content: Russia launched a record 188 drones at Ukraine overnight, Kyiv said Tuesday, amid growing international tensions after Russia fired a nuclear-capable missile that could reach European cities.
summary: Russia launched a record 188 drones at Ukraine overnight, Kyiv said Tuesday, amid growing international tensions after Russia fired a nuclear-capable missile that could reach European cities.

title: Opinion: Two Sides Of The Same Coin: Fundamentalists Share Worldview Yet Remain Hostile
content: Earlier this month, tragic news from Texas brought the abortion debate into sharp focus.
summary: Earlier this month, tragic news from Texas brought the abortion debate into sharp focus.

title: Kanwal Aftab Becomes Latest Victim In Series Of Pak Influencer Video Leaks
content: The leaked video has sparked debates about digital privacy and the growing problem of online harassment targeting influencers.
summary: The leaked video has sparked debates about digital privacy and the growing problem of online harassment targeting influencers.

title: Social Media, Artificial Intelligence Fuelling "Worst Human Impulses": United Nations Head
content: Uncontrolled social media networks and artificial intelligence amplify the worst human impulses, allowing hate speech to spread like wildfire and ignite violence, UN secretary general Antonio Guterres said on Tuesday.
summary: Uncontrolled social media networks and artificial intelligence amplify the worst human impulses, allowing hate speech to spread like wildfire and ignite violence, UN secretary general Antonio Guterres said on Tuesday.

title: "Remarkable Global Progress": HIV Cases, Deaths Declining
content: The number of new HIV infections and deaths is falling worldwide, marking significant progress in the fight against the disease.
summary: The number of new HIV infections and deaths is falling worldwide, marking significant progress in the fight against the disease.

title: Meet Ajahn Siripanyo, The Monk Who Gave Up His Father's $5 Billion Empire
content: The only son of Malaysian billionaire Ananda Krishnan, Ven Ajahn Siripanyo gave up the world of riches and spoils to become a Buddhist monk.
summary: The only son of Malaysian billionaire Ananda Krishnan, Ven Ajahn Siripanyo gave up the world of riches and spoils to become a Buddhist monk.

title: World's Oldest Man Dies At 112: Guinness World Records
content: The world's oldest man, Briton John Tinniswood, has died aged 112 at the care home where he lived in Southport, northwest England, Guinness World Records said on Tuesday, quoting his family.
summary: The world's oldest man, Briton John Tinniswood, has died aged 112 at the care home where he lived in Southport, northwest England, Guinness World Records said on Tuesday, quoting his family.

title: Warren Buffett Donates $1.2 Billion, Reflects Upon How "Fickle" Life Can Be
content: Warren Buffett, philanthropist and multi-billionaire CEO of American multinational conglomerate Berkshire Hathaway, has donated another $1.2 billion of his wealth to foundations, serving his 2006 pledge to steadily donate his $150 billion wealth.
summary: Warren Buffett, philanthropist and multi-billionaire CEO of American multinational conglomerate Berkshire Hathaway, has donated another $1.2 billion of his wealth to foundations, serving his 2006 pledge to steadily donate his $150 billion wealth.

title: China Deploys Forces As US Aircraft Flies Over Taiwan Strait
content: Beijing said Tuesday it deployed air and naval forces to monitor a US military plane as it flew over politically sensitive waters separating China and Taiwan.
summary: Beijing said Tuesday it deployed air and naval forces to monitor a US military plane as it flew over politically sensitive waters separating China and Taiwan.

title: Walmart To Scale Back Diversity Initiatives Amid Conservative Pressure
content: A Walmart spokesperson confirmed the changes, stating, "We are willing to change alongside our associates and customers who represent all of America."
summary: A Walmart spokesperson confirmed the changes, stating, "We are willing to change alongside our associates and customers who represent all of America."
